items.content_html: Atticus knows exactly where the Hot Wheels are kept at Fred Meyer. I took him and Finnian around the store while Emily got groceries and he led us right there. I donâ€™t know if we can ever go there anymore and not bring home at least 2 new cars.
A friend gave us some bourbon soaked cherries for cocktails. I must say they go amazingly well in an old fashioned.
Red velvet cake (especially frozen) is the best cake. Come at me.
New post from jsorge.net: Finny Turns 2
I was not expecting this day to start out with 2 new tires on our van.
New post from jsorge.net: This is My New Site; It Looks Like The Old Site

Iâ€™ve written over 1100 words about my Maverick building and deployment process and feel like thereâ€™s so much left to say. Maybe I should split this up into a few parts. Itâ€™s too late tonight and I need to get to bed. Eventually Iâ€™ll publish a post on this new blog system of mine!

Spent the bus ride into work fixing a few bugs in Maverick. Iâ€™ve seen it crash when I tried giving it a bad date (which I didnâ€™t think I had any more of â€“Â whoops!). It should be much more stable now, and the feeds should all work too!

I decided to go for it. My web site is now powered by Maverick, my homegrown blog engine. Iâ€™ll have some posts coming soon about some of the process I went through to make it. Iâ€™m so excited to have this thing live!
Iâ€™m soooooooooo close to getting my site running on Maverick! Probably tomorrow or Thursday!
I wish there were the chastity belt equivalent for diapers and pull ups. I could very much use a pair right now for these boys of mine.
My day one App Store downloads from 10 years ago.
Adulting achievement unlocked: Signed life insurance papers.
Backyard dinner.

Well Iâ€™m stunned that both boys had to be woken up at 8:45. Which is great because I was up until 2 around the fire pit with some good friends.

I made breakfast for us and got us all dressed and we got to church for the 11. Prayers answered!

We went to Imagine Childrenâ€™s Museum with my mom and the boys had a great time. They were wiped out when we got home and had good naps.

Iâ€™d say today was a success.
Emily is out of town this weekend so itâ€™s just me and the boys. First time Iâ€™ve taken care of both of them for this long on my own. Prayers appreciated ðŸ˜Š
Well this is quite the forecast commentary from my weather app.
I just found out that thereâ€™s a beta of Fluid v2 and I am so excited! I use this every day to silo web apps at work and v1 has started falling down on me a bit (especially with GitHub).
Hello from macOS Mojave!

I played around with a long shutter on my camera to shoot some fireworks tonight. Iâ€™m pretty happy with some of the results.

Happy 4th of July!
Itâ€™s impressive that this school can disable fire on its property.
Iâ€™m taking the citizen survey for my city and realizing how bad of a job I do of knowing what goes on in our city government and local community.
The thing I love about doing the taphouse.io project is that it will help me get my blog running using Maverick. I needed to get TLS working to enable the APIs for Micropub and XML-RPC.
And just like that taphouse.io is backed by letsprotect in Docker. Think itâ€™s worth writing up how I added TLS to an nginx Docker container?
